reg_info.full_title: O. Reg. 221/00: WITHDRAWAL AND DELEGATION OF MINISTER'S AUTHORITY - REGIONAL MUNICIPALITY OF NIAGARA
reg_info.reg_name_text: WITHDRAWAL AND DELEGATION OF MINISTER’S AUTHORITY — REGIONAL MUNICIPALITY OF NIAGARA
reg_info.citation: O. Reg. 221/00: WITHDRAWAL AND DELEGATION OF MINISTER'S AUTHORITY - REGIONAL MUNICIPALITY OF NIAGARA
reg_info.act_under: Planning Act   Loi sur l’aménagement du territoire

content.content: 1. In this Regulation, “Minister’s authority” means the Minister’s authority to give approval under section 51 of the Act, as it existed immediately before March 28, 1995, by section 74.1 of the Act with respect to, (a) applications for approval of plans of subdivision whose file numbers are set out in Schedules 1 and 2, and (b) applications for approval or exemption of condominium descriptions under section 50 of the Condominium Act whose file numbers are set out in Schedules 3, 4 and 5. O. Reg. 221/00, s. 1.
content.raw_html:
1. In this Regulation,

“Minister’s authority” means the Minister’s authority to give approval under section 51 of the Act, as it existed immediately before March 28, 1995, by section 74.1 of the Act with respect to,

(a) applications for approval of plans of subdivision whose file numbers are set out in Schedules 1 and 2, and

(b) applications for approval or exemption of condominium descriptions under section 50 of the Condominium Act whose file numbers are set out in Schedules 3, 4 and 5. O. Reg. 221/00, s. 1.

content.content: 2. The delegation of the Minister’s authority to the council of The Regional Municipality of Niagara with respect to applications for approval set out in Schedules 1, 2, 3 and 4 is withdrawn. O. Reg. 221/00, s. 2.
content.raw_html: 2. The delegation of the Minister’s authority to the council of The Regional Municipality of Niagara with respect to applications for approval set out in Schedules 1, 2, 3 and 4 is withdrawn. O. Reg. 221/00, s. 2.

content.content: 3. (1) The Minister’s authority with respect to the applications whose file numbers are listed in Schedule 1 is delegated to the council of the City of Port Colborne. O. Reg. 221/00, s. 3 (1). (2) The Minister’s authority with respect to the applications whose file numbers are listed in Schedule 2 is delegated to the council of the Township of Wainfleet. O. Reg. 221/00, s. 3 (2). (3) The Minister’s authority with respect to the applications whose file numbers are listed in Schedule 3 is delegated to the council of the City of St. Catharines. O. Reg. 221/00, s. 3 (3). (4) The Minister’s authority with respect to the applications whose file numbers are listed in Schedule 4 is delegated to the council of the City of Welland. O. Reg. 221/00, s. 3 (4). (5) The Minister’s authority with respect to the applications whose file numbers are listed in Schedule 5 is delegated to the council of the City of Niagara Falls. O. Reg. 221/00, s. 3 (5).
content.raw_html:
3. (1) The Minister’s authority with respect to the applications whose file numbers are listed in Schedule 1 is delegated to the council of the City of Port Colborne. O. Reg. 221/00, s. 3 (1).

(2) The Minister’s authority with respect to the applications whose file numbers are listed in Schedule 2 is delegated to the council of the Township of Wainfleet. O. Reg. 221/00, s. 3 (2).

(3) The Minister’s authority with respect to the applications whose file numbers are listed in Schedule 3 is delegated to the council of the City of St. Catharines. O. Reg. 221/00, s. 3 (3).

(4) The Minister’s authority with respect to the applications whose file numbers are listed in Schedule 4 is delegated to the council of the City of Welland. O. Reg. 221/00, s. 3 (4).

(5) The Minister’s authority with respect to the applications whose file numbers are listed in Schedule 5 is delegated to the council of the City of Niagara Falls. O. Reg. 221/00, s. 3 (5).

content.content: 4. (1) If any of the Minister’s authority delegated to a council is in turn subdelegated by the council to a committee of council or an appointed officer under subsection 5 (1) of the Act, the council shall forward to the Minister a certified copy of the delegating by-law within 15 days of its passing. O. Reg. 221/00, s. 4 (1). (2) The delegation of authority set out in this Regulation is not terminated by reason only that subsection (1) is not complied with. O. Reg. 221/00, s. 4 (2).
content.raw_html:
4. (1) If any of the Minister’s authority delegated to a council is in turn subdelegated by the council to a committee of council or an appointed officer under subsection 5 (1) of the Act, the council shall forward to the Minister a certified copy of the delegating by-law within 15 days of its passing. O. Reg. 221/00, s. 4 (1).

(2) The delegation of authority set out in this Regulation is not terminated by reason only that subsection (1) is not complied with. O. Reg. 221/00, s. 4 (2).

content.content: 5. Omitted (provides for coming into force of provisions of this Regulation). O. Reg. 221/00, s. 5. SCHEDULE 1   CITY OF PORT COLBORNE 26T-76046 26T-90011 26T-91014 O. Reg. 221/00, Sched. 3. SCHEDULE 4   CITY OF WELLAND 26CD-86007 O. Reg. 221/00, Sched. 4. SCHEDULE 5   CITY OF NIAGARA FALLS 26CD-92003 O. Reg. 221/00, Sched. 5.
content.raw_html:
